1.description: 1st line for 6-12 year olds with low severity Acute Otitis Media

dose_strategy.instruction: 250-500 mg of paracetamol 6-8 hourly to deal with pain
dose_strategy.patientInstruction: Divide the total daily dose into three equal doses. Administer every 8 hours with meals.

2.description: 1st line for 1-5 year olds with low severity Acute Otitis Media

dose_strategy.instruction: 120-250 mg of paracetamol 6-8 hourly to deal with pain
dose_strategy.patientInstruction: Divide the total daily dose into three equal doses. Administer every 8 hours with meals.

3.description: 1st line treatment for 6-12 year olds with high severity Acute Otitis Media

dose_strategy.instruction: 250-500 mg of paracetamol 6-8 hourly to deal with pain
dose_strategy.patientInstruction: Divide the total daily dose into three equal doses. Administer every 8 hours with meals.

dose_strategy.instruction: 400/57mg (amox:clavulanic acid) suspension every 12 horus for 10 days
dose_strategy.therapeuticDose: Raito of 7:1  (400/57mg) Amoxicillin to Clavulanic acid

4.description: 1st line treatment for 1-5 year olds with high severity Acute Otitis Media

dose_strategy.instruction: 120-250 mg of paracetamol 6-8 hourly to deal with pain
dose_strategy.patientInstruction: Divide the total daily dose into three equal doses. Administer every 8 hours with meals.

dose_strategy.instruction: Ratio of 7:1 of 200/28.5mg (Amoxicillin to Clavulanic acid) suspension every 12 hours for 10 days

5.description: Low severity AOM ages 3-8 with Penicillin Allergy

dose_strategy.patientInstruction: Divide the total daily dose into three equal doses. Administer every 8 hours with meals.

6.description: Low severity AOM ages 1-2 with Penicillin Allergy

dose_strategy.patientInstruction: Divide the total daily dose into three equal doses. Administer every 8 hours with meals.

7.description: 2nd line for children 1-18 with AOM Penicillin Allergy

dose_strategy.patientInstruction: Divide the total daily dose into three equal doses. Administer every 8 hours with meals.

22.description: 2nd line treatment for less serious adult bacterial infection cases

25.description: 1st line treatment for adult with serious Pneumonia

dose_strategy.instruction: 500mg 3-4 times a day for 7 days for pain management
1200mg every 8 hours for 7-10 days, change to oral when possible

26.description: 2nd line treatment for adult with serious Pneumonia who cannot swallow

dose_strategy.instruction: 500mg once a day for 3-7 days, revert to oral Azithromycin when possible

27.description: 1st line treatment for adult with serious Pneumonia and Penicillin Allergy

dose_strategy.instruction: 500mg once a day for 3-7 days, revert to oral Azithromycin when possible

29.description: 1st line treatment for less serious young child bacterial infection cases

30.description: 2nd line treatment for less serious adult Pneumonia

dose_strategy.instruction: 30mg/kg/day in two divided doses for 7 days
